title: Want to buy new car. Income is permeant SSDI. Credit cards, in "collections", can creditors make me sell this new car after ?
question: Only income "permanent" Social Security Disability. Want to use the "cash for clunkers car program".
answers:
If your not on SSI, and you can buy the car all in cash (assuming you can't use credit with your situation) - they may and try to take the car later if they discover it. But it is usual for them to go after cars, but not unheard of.

You can legally buy it, the real question will be if you can keep it.

Matt is right that you can legally buy the car but the real question is if you will be able to keep it and avoid having a creditor take it away so it can be sold and th eproceeds applied to your debt with them. The law is different in each state when it comes to creditors rights and debtors rights and allowable collection enforcement, so you should talk to a lawyer near you in your state. Call your local attorney bar association and ask for a referral to a debtor attorney who handles your kind of dispute. Be sure you know what to do before you buy the car.
